value.title: Get your Power BI Report Server Product Key (Minute Monday)
value.excerpt: In this Minute Monday, Adam shows you how to get your Power BI Report Server product key. This will allow you to install a valid copy of Power BI Report Server.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://www.facebook.com/guyinacube -- Snapchat

value.title: Getting out of the cube (the day before the Pre-Con)
value.excerpt: Traveling to Atlanta, Georgia for the Atalanta BI SQL Saturday. Doing a Pre-Conference talk on Friday (all day talk) and a main session on Saturday. This was the day I arrived and met up with my Co-Presenter (Patrick LeBlanc).  A day in the life of Adam...  SUBSCRIBE! https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCFp1vaKzpfvoGai0vE5VJ0w?sub_confirmation=1

value.title: Getting started with Power BI for the DBA
value.excerpt: I look at how to get up and running with Power BI from a DBA perspective.  Really for someone that doesn't know anything about data models, or measures, etc...  Calculated Columns and Measures in DAX http://www.sqlbi.com/articles/calculated-columns-and-measures-in-dax/  Calculated Tables in Power BI

value.title: Getting the latest SQL Server Native Client

value.title: Give external users access to your Azure Analysis Services server
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at how you can provide access to your Azure Analysis Services server to external users. This is done by way of the Business to Business (B2B) capabilities of Azure Active Directory. He then takes it to the next level and shows how you can then take advantage of this within

value.title: Good bye PASS BA 2016
value.excerpt: Last day at the PASS Business Analytics conference. More time in the exhibition hall. Attended a few sessions and relaxed with some friends. Ended up doing a video walk in downtown with a friend. Which was awesome! value.title: Hex Tile, DAX and narratives - Roundup #44
value.excerpt: Jason Thomas looks at how to create a Hex Tile Grid Map in Power BI. Bill Anton looks at how you can use DAX to accomplish a logical AND. Chris Webb uses DAX to create dynamic chart titles in Power BI. And, a new Power BI custom visual is available for natural language narratives.  Hex Tile Grid Maps

value.title: How to get and use custom visuals with Power BI
value.excerpt: I look at how you can use the Visuals gallery to get custom visuals and then import them into Power BI Desktop or the Power BI service, and then publish those reports to Power BI. value.title: Improve Power BI Report performance by using the filter pane
value.excerpt: If you are using slicers in your Power BI report, moving them off to the filter pane could improve performance. Patrick shows you what this could look like based on a real customer story.  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton -- http://twitter.com/patrickdba
